content: I agree, and it looks like the trend is moving in that direction. Many gaming companies have been actively working to support cross-platform play, and we've seen several successful examples of it already. Games like Fortnite, Rocket League, and Minecraft have all implemented cross-platform play, allowing players on different platforms to play together. Additionally, with the growing popularity of cloud gaming services, like Google Stadia and Microsoft xCloud, cross-platform play may become even more prevalent in the future. Ultimately, it's a positive development for gamers, as it will help bring people together and allow them to enjoy games with their friends, regardless of which platform they prefer.
